member.name: T:FarPoint.Web.Chart.AreaSeries
member.summary: Represents an area series in a Y plot area.
member.remarks: Each point contains a single value. Area borders and area fills can be assigned for the series or for a point in the series with null (Nothing in VB) indicating unassigned. Area depth is measured relative to the floor grid cell (with a range of 0 to 1). Area origin can be automatically generated or manually assigned.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Web.Chart.AreaSeries.AutoOrigin
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the area origin is automatically calculated or manually assigned.
member.remarks: If false, then the area origin is manually assigned via the Origin property. If true, then area origin is automatically calculated as the minimum value in the series.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Web.Chart.ClusteredBarSeries.Overlap
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of overlap of data points within a category.
member.exception: value is less than -1 or is greater than 1.
member.remarks: Overlap is measured relative to the data point width (-1 = separated by width of data point, 0 = no overlap or separation, 1 = overlapped by width of data point).

member.name: P:FarPoint.Web.Chart.ClusteredBarSeries.GapWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of space between categories.
member.exception: value is less than zero or is greater than 5.
member.remarks: Gap width is measured relative to the data point width (0 = no gap, 1 = gap and data point have the same width).

member.name: P:FarPoint.Web.Chart.ClusteredBarSeries.GapDepth
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of space between series.
member.exception: value is less than zero or is greater than 5.
member.remarks: gap depth is measured relative to the data point depth (0 = no gap, 1 = gap and data point have the same depth).

member.name: P:FarPoint.Web.Chart.ClusteredBarSeries.AutoOrigin
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the bar origin is automatically calculated or manually assigned.
member.remarks: If false then the bar origin is manually assigned via the Origin property. If true then bar origin is automatically calculated as the minimum value in the series.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Web.Chart.ClusteredBarSeries.Origin
member.summary: Gets or sets the bar origin.
member.remarks: This property is only used when AutOrigin is false.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Web.Chart.ClusteredBarSeries.CategoryNames
member.summary: Gets the collection of category names for the series.

member.name: T:FarPoint.Web.Chart.LegendArea
member.summary: Represents a legend area in the chart.
member.remarks: The legend area can contain legend items, background, and border. The legend area is positioned using a relative location (where (0,0) = left upper corner of chart and (1,1) = right lower corner of chart) and a relative alignment (where (0,0) = left upper corner of label area and (1,1) = right lower corner of label area).

member.name: T:FarPoint.Web.Chart.OpenHighLowCloseSeries
member.summary: Represents an open-high-low-close series in a Y plot area.
member.remarks: Each point contains four values: open, high, low, and close. Attributes for the up and down lines can be assigned for the series or for a point in the series with null (Nothing in VB) indicating unassigned. Bar widthis measured relative to the floor grid cell (with values in the range 0 to 1).

member.name: T:FarPoint.Web.Chart.PlotArea
member.summary: Represents the base class for plot areas.
member.remarks: The plot area is positioned using a relative location (where (0,0) = left upper corner of chart and (1,1) = right lower corner of chart) and a relative size (where (0,0) = zero size and (1,1) = size of chart). The plot area has rotation and elevation specified in degrees.

member.summary: Gets or sets the location of the plot area in control canvas space.

member.exception: Value's x or y is less than zero or greater than one.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Web.Chart.PlotArea.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the plot area in control canvas space.
member.remarks: Size is measured in relative units ((0,0) = no size, (1,1) = size of control).
member.exception: Value's width or height is less than or equal to zero or greater than one.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Web.Chart.PlotArea.Depth
member.summary: Gets or sets the depth of the plot area.
member.remarks: Depth is measured relative to width of plot area (0 = no depth, 1 = depth and width are equal).
member.exception: Value is less than or equal to zero or greater than 20.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Web.Chart.PlotArea.Elevation
member.summary: Gets of sets the counterclockwise rotation around the horizontal axis.
member.remarks: Elevation is measured in degrees.
member.exception: Value is less than -90 or greater than 90.

member.name: P:FarPoint.Web.Chart.PlotArea.Rotation
member.summary: Gets of sets the counterclockwise rotation around the vertical axis.
member.remarks: Rotation is measured in degrees.
member.exception: Value is less than -180 or greater than 180.

member.summary: Gets or sets the projection from 3D model space to 2D control canvas space.

member.name: T:FarPoint.Web.Chart.PointSeries
member.summary: Represents a point series in a Y plot area.
member.remarks: Each point contains of a single value. Point borders, point fills and point markers can be assigned for the series or for a point in the series with null (Nothing in VB) indicating unassigned. Point depth is measured relative to the floor grid cell (with values in the range 0 to 1).

member.name: T:FarPoint.Web.Chart.PolarRadiusAxis
member.summary: Represents a numeric axis.
member.remarks: An axis can have a ruler line, major/minor tick marks, major tick mark labels, major/minor grid lines, and stripes. The direction of the axis can be reversed. member.remarks: An axis can have a title, a ruler line, major/minor tick marks, tick mark labels, major/minor grid lines, and stripes. The direction of the axis can be reversed. The minimum, maximum, and major/minor units can be automatically generated or manually assigned. The scale can be linear or logarithmic.

member.summary: Represents a numeric axis.
member.remarks: An axis can have a title, a ruler line, major/minor tick marks, tick mark labels, major/minor grid lines, and stripes. The direction of the axis can be reversed. member.name: T:FarPoint.Web.Chart.XYBubbleSeries
member.summary: Represents a bubble series in a Y plot area.
member.remarks: Each point contains two values: value and size. Bubble borders and bubble fills can be assigned for the series or for a point in the series with null(Nothing in VB) indicating unassigned. Bubble size is measured relative to plot area width (with a range 0 to 1). Bubble depth is is measured relative to floor grid (with a range of 0 to 1).

member.name: T:FarPoint.Web.Chart.XYPlotArea
member.summary: Represents a XY plot area in a chart model.
member.remarks: The plot area has an x-axis, a y-axis, a z-axis, and up to six walls. The x-axis and y-axis represent values. The z-axis represents series.

member.name: T:Win32.WinConst.WindowPosFlags
member.summary: Specifies the window position, flags for WINDOWPOS structure.

member.name: F:Win32.WinConst.WindowPosFlags.SWP_DRAWFRAME
member.summary: Draws a frame (defined in the window's class description) around the window.

member.name: F:Win32.WinConst.WindowPosFlags.SWP_FRAMECHANGED
member.summary: Sends a WM_NCCALCSIZE message to the window, even if the window's size is not being changed. If this flag is not specified, WM_NCCALCSIZE is sent only when the window's size is being changed.

member.name: F:Win32.WinConst.WindowPosFlags.SWP_HIDEWINDOW
member.summary: Hides the window.

member.name: F:Win32.WinConst.WindowPosFlags.SWP_NOACTIVATE
member.summary: Does not activate the window. If this flag is not set, the window is activated and moved to the top of either the topmost or non-topmost group (depending on the setting of the hwndInsertAfter member).

member.name: F:Win32.WinConst.WindowPosFlags.SWP_NOCOPYBITS
member.summary: Discards the entire contents of the client area. If this flag is not specified, the valid contents of the client area are saved and copied back into the client area after the window is sized or repositioned.

member.name: F:Win32.WinConst.WindowPosFlags.SWP_NOMOVE
member.summary: Retains the current position (ignores the x and y parameters).

member.name: F:Win32.WinConst.WindowPosFlags.SWP_NOOWNERZORDER
member.summary: Does not change the owner window's position in the Z order.

member.name: F:Win32.WinConst.WindowPosFlags.SWP_NOREDRAW
member.summary: Does not redraw changes. If this flag is set, no repainting of any kind occurs. This applies to the client area, the nonclient area (including the title bar and scroll bars), and any part of the parent window uncovered as a result of the window being moved. When this flag is set, the application must explicitly invalidate or redraw any parts of the window and parent window that need redrawing.

member.name: F:Win32.WinConst.WindowPosFlags.SWP_NOREPOSITION
member.summary: Same as the SWP_NOOWNERZORDER flag.

member.name: F:Win32.WinConst.WindowPosFlags.SWP_NOSENDCHANGING
member.summary: Prevents the window from receiving the WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING message.

member.name: F:Win32.WinConst.WindowPosFlags.SWP_NOSIZE
member.summary: Retains the current size (ignores the cx and cy parameters).

member.name: F:Win32.WinConst.WindowPosFlags.SWP_NOZORDER
member.summary: Retains the current Z order (ignores the hwndInsertAfter parameter).

member.name: F:Win32.WinConst.WindowPosFlags.SWP_SHOWWINDOW
member.summary: Displays the window.

member.name: T:Win32.WinConst.DeviceContextValues
member.summary: Values to pass to the GetDCEx method.

member.name: F:Win32.WinConst.DeviceContextValues.Window
member.summary: DCX_WINDOW: Returns a DC that corresponds to the window rectangle rather than the client rectangle.

member.name: F:Win32.WinConst.DeviceContextValues.Cache
member.summary: DCX_CACHE: Returns a DC from the cache, rather than the OWNDC or CLASSDC window. Essentially overrides CS_OWNDC and CS_CLASSDC.

member.name: F:Win32.WinConst.DeviceContextValues.NoResetAttrs
member.summary: DCX_NORESETATTRS: Does not reset the attributes of this DC to the default attributes when this DC is released.

member.name: F:Win32.WinConst.DeviceContextValues.ClipChildren
member.summary: DCX_CLIPCHILDREN: Excludes the visible regions of all child windows below the window identified by hWnd.

member.name: F:Win32.WinConst.DeviceContextValues.ClipSiblings
member.summary: DCX_CLIPSIBLINGS: Excludes the visible regions of all sibling windows above the window identified by hWnd.

member.name: F:Win32.WinConst.DeviceContextValues.ParentClip
member.summary: DCX_PARENTCLIP: Uses the visible region of the parent window. The parent's WS_CLIPCHILDREN and CS_PARENTDC style bits are ignored. The origin is set to the upper-left corner of the window identified by hWnd.

member.name: F:Win32.WinConst.DeviceContextValues.ExcludeRgn
member.summary: DCX_EXCLUDERGN: The clipping region identified by hrgnClip is excluded from the visible region of the returned DC.

member.name: F:Win32.WinConst.DeviceContextValues.IntersectRgn
member.summary: DCX_INTERSECTRGN: The clipping region identified by hrgnClip is intersected with the visible region of the returned DC.

member.name: F:Win32.WinConst.DeviceContextValues.ExcludeUpdate
member.summary: DCX_EXCLUDEUPDATE: Unknown...Undocumented

member.name: F:Win32.WinConst.DeviceContextValues.IntersectUpdate
member.summary: DCX_INTERSECTUPDATE: Unknown...Undocumented

member.name: F:Win32.WinConst.DeviceContextValues.LockWindowUpdate
member.summary: DCX_LOCKWINDOWUPDATE: Allows drawing even if there is a LockWindowUpdate call in effect that would otherwise exclude this window. Used for drawing during tracking.

member.name: F:Win32.WinConst.DeviceContextValues.Validate
member.summary: DCX_VALIDATE When specified with DCX_INTERSECTUPDATE, causes the DC to be completely validated. Using this function with both DCX_INTERSECTUPDATE and DCX_VALIDATE is identical to using the BeginPaint function.

member.name: T:Win32.WinConst.TrackMouseEventFlags
member.summary: Flags for TRACKMOUSEEVENT structure

member.name: T:Win32.WinConst.ReDrawWindowFlags
member.summary: RedrawWindow() flags

member.name: F:Win32.WinConst.ReDrawWindowFlags.RDW_ERASE
member.summary: Causes the window to receive a WM_ERASEBKGND message when the window is repainted. The RDW_INVALIDATE flag must also be specified; otherwise, RDW_ERASE has no effect.

member.name: F:Win32.WinConst.ReDrawWindowFlags.RDW_FRAME
member.summary: Causes any part of the nonclient area of the window that intersects the update region to receive a WM_NCPAINT message. The RDW_INVALIDATE flag must also be specified; otherwise, RDW_FRAME has no effect. The WM_NCPAINT message is typically not sent during the execution of RedrawWindow unless either RDW_UPDATENOW or RDW_ERASENOW is specified.

member.name: F:Win32.WinConst.ReDrawWindowFlags.RDW_INTERNALPAINT
member.summary: Causes a WM_PAINT message to be posted to the window regardless of whether any portion of the window is invalid.

member.name: F:Win32.WinConst.ReDrawWindowFlags.RDW_INVALIDATE
member.summary: Invalidates lprcUpdate or hrgnUpdate (only one may be non-NULL). If both are NULL, the entire window is invalidated.

member.name: F:Win32.WinConst.ReDrawWindowFlags.RDW_NOERASE
member.summary: Suppresses any pending WM_ERASEBKGND messages.

member.name: F:Win32.WinConst.ReDrawWindowFlags.RDW_NOFRAME
member.summary: Suppresses any pending WM_NCPAINT messages. This flag must be used with RDW_VALIDATE and is typically used with RDW_NOCHILDREN. RDW_NOFRAME should be used with care, as it could cause parts of a window to be painted improperly.

member.name: F:Win32.WinConst.ReDrawWindowFlags.RDW_NOINTERNALPAINT
member.summary: Suppresses any pending internal WM_PAINT messages. This flag does not affect WM_PAINT messages resulting from a non-NULL update area.

member.name: F:Win32.WinConst.ReDrawWindowFlags.RDW_VALIDATE
member.summary: Validates lprcUpdate or hrgnUpdate (only one may be non-NULL). If both are NULL, the entire window is validated. This flag does not affect internal WM_PAINT messages

member.name: F:Win32.WinConst.ReDrawWindowFlags.RDW_ERASENOW
member.summary: Causes the affected windows (as specified by the RDW_ALLCHILDREN and RDW_NOCHILDREN flags) to receive WM_NCPAINT and WM_ERASEBKGND messages, if necessary, before the function returns. WM_PAINT messages are received at the ordinary time.

member.name: F:Win32.WinConst.ReDrawWindowFlags.RDW_UPDATENOW
member.summary: Causes the affected windows (as specified by the RDW_ALLCHILDREN and RDW_NOCHILDREN flags) to receive WM_NCPAINT, WM_ERASEBKGND, and WM_PAINT messages, if necessary, before the function returns.

member.name: F:Win32.WinConst.ReDrawWindowFlags.RDW_ALLCHILDREN
member.summary: Includes child windows, if any, in the repainting operation.

member.name: F:Win32.WinConst.ReDrawWindowFlags.RDW_NOCHILDREN
member.summary: Excludes child windows, if any, from the repainting operation.

member.name: F:Win32.WinStructs.NCCALCSIZE_PARAMS.rectModified
member.summary: Contains the new coordinates of a window that has been moved or resized, that is, it is the proposed new window coordinates.

member.name: F:Win32.WinStructs.NCCALCSIZE_PARAMS.rectBeforeMove
member.summary: Contains the coordinates of the window before it was moved or resized.

member.name: F:Win32.WinStructs.NCCALCSIZE_PARAMS.rectClientBeforeMove
member.summary: Contains the coordinates of the window's client area before the window was moved or resized.

member.name: F:Win32.WinStructs.NCCALCSIZE_PARAMS.lpPos
member.summary: Pointer to a WINDOWPOS structure that contains the size and position values specified in the operation that moved or resized the window.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Licenses.PowerToolsLicenseProvider.VerifyDesignTimeEnvironment
member.summary: Verify the environment to get whether the component is in design-time.
member.returns: true if it is in design-time; otherwise false.
member.remarks: In DesignTime, because of IDE bugs, some component are not created with DesigntimeLicenseContext. For example, when drag a control from Win Forms DataSource tool window, or use a web control in a ASP.NET Template. This may cause the control do run-time license validation and found that there is no license. To resolve this problem, we will check the environment and decide whether to do design-time license validation again.

member.name: T:FarPoint.Web.Chart.HttpHandlerImageRender
member.summary: The HttpHandlerImageRender renders the chart image to memory using the and returns the image Url.
member.remarks:
HttpHandlerImageRender is recommended when charts are simple (easy to generate) or when you expect requests for a large number of different charts.
HttpHandlerImageRender supplies two ways to save an image on the server, one is saving in HttpContext.Session and another is saving in HttpContext.Cache. An application developer can set the storage means by the property and determine whether to hold the image data or clear it immediately after rendering by using the property.

member.name: T:FarPoint.Web.Chart.FileImageRender
member.summary: The FileImageRender renders a chart image to the local temporary files and returns the image Url.
member.remarks:
Repeated requests for the same chart use the same file to reduce load on the server. New requests create new files as needed. Files are not cleaned up automatically.
FileImageRender is recommended when charts are complex (expensive to generate) or when you expect a large number of requests for a relatively small number of different charts.
